dict.string: +** /end terminate the room server kicking all off -> { -/(kill|end) [n] [msg] }

- name unclear: point is to delay a flush for another 7 seconds -> which means we need also commands or priv levels that can prevent this from happening.... guess flash wars will simply be part of it as I don't reckon it's simple to refrain the use of ctrl-c

+ /flush { ~/flush [n] [msg] } flushes your history, frees up some memory and may save your settings to file if roomServerSettings allow to do so. To flush your telnet screen press esc followed by c to flush on html frontend use the button
+** /flushAll flushes all in the room, logged on or not
-*** /flushChildren flushAll but also down the tree into all private rooms (that aren't savehavens...)

+*** /get [domain] path/in/plist access properties directly where domain is one of: ([my] | (room | sys | system) or (com | comm | commands) or smile or (user (uid | name))) Paths are case sensitive. Without domain, user currentUID is inserted.
domains are: my, room, system, commands, smile there is a special domain: user syntax: /get user (uid|name) /path/in/plist the / at the beginning of paths is optional
+ /help [command] shows the help text to certain command or to all commands if command is left out.
+* /kick (uid | name) force a user to leave without blacklisting. Is often a friendly gesture when a connection hangs and the user can't log in anymore.
- /* sytax unclear show the items I could use according to my privs.
-* /nameof user newname change displayed name of other user
- /recho [n] repeat the last n posts to me, I was typing... defaults to whatever the room setting has as default for it's users
-* /passwordof user newpassword change password of other user
+** /run command [arg1 arg2 ...] run an escaped sh command.

+** /set domain path/in/plist value /set domain plist/Path [-t (a | b | da | de | f | i | s)] value set properties directly. domains are: my, room, system, commands, smile there is a special domain: user syntax: /set user (uid | name) /path/in/plist [-t ...] value the / at the beginning of paths is optional. They are case-sensitive. -type | -t : type modifier define the value-type: a array (currently: if "-t a" present, value is ignored and the value for path is set to an empty array which can then be populated: "/set path/to/arrayKey/0 value" where 0 is the first index
~** /($|shell) phpToPassThruEval ... just an idea of having an interactive php shell, maybe iPHP can help out
-* /uidOf name get the uid of a name
